pageContext.claim: “We have the best and the lowest unemployment in history for black and they love it. African-American people have never had a job situation like this, the lowest in history, unemployment.”
pageContext.analysis: The black unemployment rate has been calculated only since 1972, so it's an exaggeration to say the current numbers are the lowest in history. Although the black unemployment rate was at an all-time-low 5.9 percent in May, that was still significantly higher than the overall unemployment rate of 3.8 percent.
